The two dimensions of organizational change

Key: mccarthy_two_2004

Author(s): McCarthy, Bill

Year: 2004

Abstract: Too many organizational change projects fail because they fail to address the people aspect. Employees don’t buy in to the changed organization and performance suffers as a result. Here, Bill McCarthy of human capital consultants Penna, addresses six common reasons why organizational change fails and suggests an approach that focuses on people within a “before, during and after” timeframe.
